Afyr is also the home of outcasts from other societies of the land of Athebes, many of whom practice the Old Religion, considered a form of black magic in these modern times. The old forests of Afyr seem to look after them and actively persecute those that pursue them. These creatures, often being terribly misunderstood themselves, tend to welcome even creatures that others would deem "evil" as long as they don't overstay their welcomes.

It is in Afyr that our assembled group of heroes has heard about a place called Imp Hollow. In this hollow there is said to be a great treasure and the key to many ancient secrets of the world of Elder.

160117.name: Zombie Zigzag
160117.description:
From publisher blurb:

Raw and meaty enough for even the most savage flesh-eater, this supplement contains new zombie-related rules, two adventures, and an original short story. Get yer braiiinnnssss right here! This king-sized supplement for TAG’s Crawlspace rules includes:

Special “Creature Feature” zombie rules taking into account the wide spectrum of folkloric, pseudo-scientific, and psychological aspects associated with the walking dead
“The Moss Men of Tippecanoe County,” an original short story by John D. Kennedy
“Camp WTF,” a Crawlspace adventure in classic zombie-thriller style by Darryl Nichols
“6 Degrees of Zombi Annihilation,” another zombie apocalypse Crawlspace adventure designed by Michael Larsen to highlight the new features of this supplement

160118.name: The Silver's Jungle
160118.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a scenario for TAG's WHAP! pulp adventure system. The player characters are summoned to Bogo, a port city in the western Belgian Congo, by the governor himself to investigate a series of murders believed to have been committed by a rogue silver-back gorilla, and resolve the situation.

160119.name: The Black Lotus Affair
160119.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a scenario for TAG's WHAP! pulp adventure system. This is the first installment of the Spunky Monkey Steampunk Series by Mike Larsen. Travel the world with SEWA. Did someone mention yetis?

160120.name: Cowboys vs Dinosaurs
160120.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this adventure for for TAG's WHAP! rules by award-winning game designer Ken St. Andre, a gang of American outlaws "vacationing" south of the border are approached by two old villagers who ask them to come save their town. The men say that beasts from hell are attacking the village: carrying off children, destroying the livestock, terrorizing the women.

Why would a gang of outlaws want to face "beasts from hell" for a couple of geezers they just met? Well, Don Geronimo and Don Tarmanganio have an answer, presenting our heroes with some samples of gold ore still in its quartz matrix and saying that much more of the yellow metal can be found in the old abandoned mine near the village of Mescalito.

Includes three new western-themed character types in addition to the adventure.

160121.name: Howls in the Wild
160121.description:
From publisher blurb:

From African jungles to remote snow-capped mountains to the Old West, these three adventures will take you on a fantastic tour the diverse cosmos of action pulp. Ken St. Andre, Mike Larsen, and Tom K. Loney pit you and your friends against rogue apes, take you around the world in eccentric steampunk vehicles, chase you with dinosaurs, and might even give you a chance to foil a vile plot hatched by skulking proto-Nazis.

These adventures require the TAG WHAP rules found in the WHAP! Deluxe book to play.

User note: this collects The Silver's Jungle, The Black Lotus Affair, and Cowboys vs Dinosaurs into one printed volume.

160122.name: Hop 'n Stop
160122.description:
A racing game with The Smurfs.

Every player has two Smurfs. Everyone also has a stopper (Gargemel). In his first turn, the player moves the runner (with a die roll). In the second turn, the stopper must be moved.
If the stopper comes on a place where a smurf is, that smurf has to start again.

Winning the game: be the first to get your two smurfs on the finish.

160123.name: Spacers
160123.description:
From publisher blurb:

This booklet provides the rules for all our TAG (Tom's Adventure Gaming) SPACERS science fiction (FreeFall) products without the adventures. Perfect if you just want to run your own space fantasy campaign with TAG.

160124.name: Rocketmen vs. the Saucers Episode II: The Straits of Sublight
160124.description:
From publisher blurb:

We are on the verge of interstellar travel. The year is 2310 AD and the solar system is teeming with humanity. Science is taking the populations of all the new worlds to heights no one has ever known before, including great zap guns and sleek outfits with finned caps. While we are in contact with alien civilizations, we are threatened by mysterious yet ancient foes. Rocket Ships guard our borders as well as explore where no one has gone before.

The crew of the Venture will be tasked with somehow retrieving the experimental Icarus-X1 after it has just tested the Beagle engines. The ship hit one-tenth the speed of light and then collided with an other-dimensional ship going faster than the speed of light.. The two ships are fused together in a weird astro-physical sort of way and the aliens, a decidedly unfriendly lot, are trying to pull both ships back into their space-time continuum. Once the Venture is in contact with the craft, they will have 26 hours to stop the "phasing" and decelerate it enough for other Oort Corp rockets to assist.

This scenario is one installment in the ongoing Rocketmen vs. the Saucers serial, but has been designed to stand alone, needing only the TAG SPACERS rules to play.

160125.description:
In Gods' Gambit, players represent fallen gods who must solve problems in the world and perform good acts to be allowed to return to the High Heavens.

By playing a card from your hand of either the same color (same location) or the same value (same trouble) as on the playing table, you clear one of the quests bestowed upon you. When one player has rid himself of all of the cards (quests) in his hand, or when a certain period of time has passed (when you've drawn four special cards from the draw deck), that round ends. The player who rid himself of cards gets closer to the High Heavens, but those with cards remaining are pushed away even further.

The gods can also use their faithful servants for their own purposes. They can help their masters to do away with surplus quests, or cause trouble for the other gods by imposing more quests on them. However, take care when you do this because all such acts remain in memory as bad karma. If you manage to complete all of your quests, your accumulated bad karma will be ignored, but if you fail and have quests remaining, they will become a heavy burden.

You will need to determine when to silently do your chores and when to use your servants to increase your chances of success.
160125.name: Gods' Gambit

160126.name: Wardenhale: City Core Set
160126.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Wardenhale, the city with a thousand names. City of Shadows. CIty of Trade, City of Justice. Wardenhale is like every city, and yet like no other"
Wardenhale City Core is a printable dungeon floorplan compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Wardenhale City Core Set is a geomorphic set, comprising 5 10x10 square battlemaps which can be arranged in multiple layouts. Each tile features cobbled streets and houses, allowing you to build unique and varied city arrangements quickly and beautifully. The Core Set combines perfectly with other maps in the Wardenhale range to allow you to build any city you can imagine.

Also included is a set of 300dpi full size jpgs, for poster printing or VTT, in both gridded and non-gridded versions. (n.b. gridless version only available as full jpeg)

160127.name: Candlelight and Murky Water
160127.description:
From publisher blurb:

Keeping the Swamp of Doom from going over to the dark side has never been easy. The crocodile folk and the demons aren't helping.

This scenario is set in Scott Malthouse’s Peakvale campaign setting. While it can be incorporated into any other T&T world, such as Trollworld or Elder, we recommend that you check out Trollish Delver Games for details first. The player characters should either have Combat Adds of 50 or more or be able to cast at least a couple of 3rd level spells. It is assumed that the players have survived the Temple of the Hag but the scenario can just as easily be played as a standalone adventure.

It should be noted that while this scenario is designed for T&T 7 and 7.5, it can easily be adjusted to any edition.

160128.name: Death at Grimwood Hall
160128.description:
From publisher blurb:

People will do strange things for love, but Margaret Grimwood of Grimwood Hall is going to take that to a whole new level. In the sleepy town of Meanderwood something stirs in the darkness. Under the moonlight a glint of steel flashes. Two shadowy figures emerge from the graveyard carrying something on their shoulders.

This adventure will take the players deep into a macabre mystery of love, power and magic inspired by Mary Shelley’s Frankenstein. Take care, for everything is not what it seems.

Death at Grimwood Hall is an adventure for 4-6 PCs (player characters) of levels 3-4, although the adventure can be scaled for other levels. This adventure was designed for use with 7th edition rules of Tunnels and Trolls, but it can easily be converted for use with 5th edition.

160129.name: It Came from Beyond the Stars!
160129.description:
From publisher blurb:

Champion the cause of King Hobbletoe and the residents of Willowmoss. Discover what fell from the night sky into the urook-infested Greyshades.

It Came from Beyond the Stars! is set in the kingdom of Peakvale in Trollworld. The main action centers around the village of Willowmoss and the Greyshades, but the location can be modified to fit your own ongoing campaign.

This is an adventure for common kindred delvers of levels 1 to 3 using 7.5 edition rules, although it is easy to modify for 5th edition.

160130.name: The Foggy Island Horror
160130.description:
From publisher blurb:

A GM adventure for Tunnels & Trolls

On the island Dunmorrin, a few miles south from the shores of the Dragon continent, the strange sorcerer Belvidore delved into magicks best left untapped. To this very day, his experiments make the island a dangerous place, which is why it's the place to be. Come get your dose of cosmic terror and sword & sorcery in this scenario.

160131.name: Cave Of the People-Eater
160131.description:
From publisher blurb:

A GM adventure for Tunnels & Trolls

A day's ride from the town of Rangle, dwells an ancient evil. Of course that is the direction every adventurer wants to go. This mini-scenario involves the tradition of T&T's deadly purple beasts, so be warned. Suitable for 5-7th Levels using any edition of the game. Great for convention play.

160132.name: New Khazan
rpgsetting: New Khazan: Adventure in the Nine Thousand Worlds
160132.description:
From publisher blurb:

More than elves and trolls in outer space, more than star warriors casting spells, New Khazan has its own unique flavor of space fantasy.

This supplement begins with the assumed background of Tunnels & Trolls, then extends all those fantastic creatures and spells into a distant future where reptilian astro-gators guide ships through tunnelspace and police subdue criminals with Hold-That-Pose nets and TTYF guns powered by smaller versions of the same Kremm crystals that drive starfaring battleships.

New Khazan gives you descriptions of the worlds, prominent kindreds, civilizations, technology, and common character types of the fantastic future.

160133.name: Baloonka: Rescue From the Fungus Planet
rpgsetting: New Khazan: Adventure in the Nine Thousand Worlds
160133.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a Game Master (GM) module written by Roy Cram for the New Khazan Setting by Tom K. Loney. You will need a copy of New Khazan: Adventures in the 9,000 Worlds (NK) and also a copy of the Tunnels & Trolls Rule Book (T&T) published by Flying Buffalo, Inc.

This adventure begins in a seedy little bar in a seedy little spaceport on a seedy little planet in the galactic rim. The name of the planet is Seedy V. It is not a good planet to visit and a worse planet to live on…

160134.name: The Quest for Trollstar Part 1: Cloudbusting
rpgsetting: New Khazan: Adventure in the Nine Thousand Worlds
160134.description:
From publisher blurb:

A signal from the ancient homeworld of all the species of the 9,000 Worlds? It simply cannot be. But there, in front of your eyes, on the eye-corder is Kharrrghish script. Could this be the key to finding the mysterious and ancient Trollstar?

The Quest for Trollstar is a series of adventures for the T&T sphere fantasy setting New Khazan. It begins here and continues with Glow World.

160135.name: The Quest for Trollstar Part 2: Glow World
rpgsetting: New Khazan: Adventure in the Nine Thousand Worlds
160135.description:
From publisher blurb:

An ancient signal from a world devastated by loose magic and radiation! Could this be all that remains of the legendary Trollworld? This is the second scenario in the Quest for Troll-Star campaign for the New Khazan campaign setting. Part one is Cloudbusting.

160136.name: Compendium Arkanum Volume 01: Cantrips & Orisons
rpgseries: The Open Gaming Store Free RPG Day 2016
160136.description:
From publisher blurb:

Compendium Arcanum Volume 1: Cantrips & Orisonsintroduces "multi-variable" spells to the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

A multi-variable spell is a spell which, once learned, you can cast as a spell one level higher or lower than the original spell. This mechanic was first introduced in Monte Cook’s Arcana Evolved. Multi-variable spells gives spellcasters great flexibility and so Tim decided to begin by adding the Heightened and Diminished qualities to Pathfinder spells.

So, in addition to the normal Pathfinder spell details, you will see one or two new bits of text, specifically, either a “Diminished Effects” line, a “Heightened Effects” line, or both. This is the first book of a set intended to include all spells from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook, Advanced Player’s Guide, Ultimate Combat, and Ultimate Magic, now with heightened and diminished effects.

DIMINISHED EFFECTS This section describes changes to the spell if it is cast using a slot one Level lower than normal. You must be able to cast a spell at its regular Level before you can use the diminished effects. If you use a diminished effect, treat the spell as one Level lower than listed for purposes of spell slot used, saving throw DCs, magic item pricing, and so on. Spells that are 0-level (or 1st-level alchemist-, paladin-, or ranger-only spells) have no diminished effects.

HEIGHTENED EFFECTS This section describes changes to the spell if it is cast using a slot one Level higher than normal. If you use a heightened effect, treat the spell as one Level higher than listed, for purposes of spell slot used, saving throw DCs, magic item pricing, and so on, regardless of what Level slot you use. Spells that are 9th Level (or 6th-level alchemist-only spells or 4th-level paladin- or ranger-only spells) have no heightened effects.

160137.name: Storium
rpghonor: 2014 Golden Geek RPG of the Year Nominee
rpgpodcastepisode: Telling Stories with Storium, a New Way  to Play.
160137.description:
From the website Storium.com:

Storium is a new kind of online game where you and your friends tell any story you can imagine, together.

160138.name: Deeds & Doers
160138.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are nothing if not extraordinary. For the likes of you, adventure awaits around every corner. The world is full to the brim with treasures both imagined and unimagined, deeds both great and sinister, foes both human and inhuman. You are an adventurer, and you will seize your destiny or die in the attempt.

Deeds and Doers is a version of D&D that fits in your wallet, takes less than half an hour of your time, and you can play on the way to work. It fits almost every rule I use to play D&D into lean, hungry package, waiting to be played.

Deeds and Doers includes a Player’s Handcard, a Dungeon Master’s Grimcarde, a character record card, a dicecard, and Adventure Module n1: Vengeance Upon Thieves, all illustrated by Tony Dowler.

160139.name: Deeds & Doers Expansion Pack
160139.description:
From publisher blurb:

An expansion pack for Deeds and Doers with three new cards:

Unearthed Arcardna, which is an alternate set of six classes: The Witch, The Traveller, The Knight, The Fool, The Doctor, and The Mendicant
Elfs, Dwarfs, et cetera, which adds rules for playing non-human classes.
The Cardpanion, which adds rules for high level (level 7 and up) play, including mass combat, magical laboratories, and followers.

160140.name: Brass Tomb of Abaan
160140.description:
User summary:

A short adventure for Deeds & Doers.

160141.name: Mountain of Swords
160141.description:
User summary:

A short adventure for Deeds & Doers.

160142.name: Storming the Dead City
160142.description:
User summary:

A short adventure for Deeds & Doers.

160144.name: A Desperate Gambit
160144.description:
User summary:

A short adventure for Deeds & Doers.

160145.name: Art and Murder
160145.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the Art and Murder Series Pitch, DramaSystem creator Robin D. Laws takes us to a post-scarcity economy, where remain only two routes to status: Art and Murder. As guardians of the Great Museum, you struggle to protect the world’s cultural patrimony from outside marauders—and your own ambitions.

160146.name: Flare Class Corvette
160146.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible starship. The ship introduced in this installment of the series is a hybrid carrier and gun platform corvette of 1200 dT.

The PDF contains the background of the ship, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains simple deckplans (Without scale or grid!) of the ship and images showing the ship from various directions.

160147.name: Spectres of Usarm
160147.description:
From publisher blurb:

To the north the mysterious Orc tribes threaten the coastial town of Icago. Already the Abbey of the Goddess Thiseir has fallen due to their raids and farmers and fishermen have reported seen the horrid pig-faced creatures moving inland.

The Cloaked Mage promised the Lord Mayor a way to be rid of the threat … no one has heard from the mayor or his family for a week. Every search attempt is a failure, the Lord Mayor's farms are protected by strange metal constructs known as Scarecrows. Strange lights streak the night sky, toward the Scarred Relic Moon … from the Lord Mayor's home.

A call goes out to anyone brave or stupid enough to aid the town; you have answered.

“Spectres of Usarm” is the Fourth Two-Page -Adventure from Genius Loci Games and the third to use the Swords & Wizardry rule set. Created for a party of 4 to 6 players of the 4th to 6th level, the “Spectres if Usarm” mixes exploration, story and combat as quickly and efficiently as possible to provide at least 2 hours of fun.

160148.name: GUMSHOE Zoom: Voodoo 1 - Magic
rpghonor: 2015 ENnie for Best Electronic Book - Nominee
2015 ENnie for Best Electronic Book - Silver Winner
160148.description:
From publisher blurb:

The first of a new series of GUMSHOE Zooms looking at historical magic traditions — and giving you the tools and rules to evoke these puissant powers in your own game! This first issue in a two-issue series examines sympathetic magic and zombies, and Zooms in on the Afro-Caribbean magical-religious complex encompassing Vodoun, Candomble, Santeria, Obeah, and Palo Mayombe. The loa ride in May!

160149.name: A Lawless Town
160149.description:
A Lawless Town is trick-taking game set in the Wild West where players must swing deals and spend their cash to pay one another off in order to come out ahead.

The game is played over the course of three round in which each player will be dealt a hand of cards which are then then use to win tricks. Unlike other trick-taking games, in A Lawless Town each trick has at least two winners.

Next players will bribe and haggle with one another in order to convince the trick winners to distribute their awards in ways that are favorable to the briber's plan.

160150.name: Symmetric
160150.description: Part of the Bagged Game Originals line, Symmetric is a symmetrically balanced abstract strategy game for two players. A player wins by having one Counter in each of their opponent's three starting spaces at the center of the board.

160151.name: The Last Stand: Dead Zone
160151.description:
The Last Stand: Dead Zone brings RPG, Action and Strategy to the zombie apocalypse.

Load out your team and run real-time missions to gather weapons, gear, construction materials and supplies in locations across the Dead Zone all while holding off the horde. With 30,000+ items available there's plenty of ways to despatch the walking dead.

Build and defend your compound to protect you from the infected and human raiders. Set up barricades and traps to hold the hordes at bay. Your survival depends on it.

Attract new survivors, decide their role then equip them to help you survive. Select from a number of classes including Fighters, Engineers, Medics, Scavengers and Recon. Each role is important and will affect your chances of survival.

Loot or craft over 30,000 weapon and gear items in real time missions across the city. Gather schematics for weapons and gear through scavenging or trade.

Raid other players for precious resources or help them with construction. Join an alliance and secure your position in the Dead Zone!

Source: The Game Website.

160152.name: Unter Hochdruck
160152.description:
user summary:
Anthology of three short adventures for Space:1889. It ist the first collection of genuine German adventures, after Uhrwerk Verlag took over publishing the game.

The three adventures play on Mars, in Central America and in Breslau respectively.

160153.name: Thy Realm
160153.description:
Thy Realm is a strategic skirmish miniature game that uses cards for the figures.

Thy Realm Card/Miniature game will take you into a fantasy realm that you control by picking your own realm and heroes. Your figures are the card therefore, there will be no need to assemble or paint just go out of the box.

Fight with your realm's heroes against other realms in strategic battles. Using cards that are your heroes miniature, you can move across the landscape of the realm. Each hero has its own abilities and or feats. There are five realms to choose from; Elvin, Dwarven, Human, Orc, and Dark.

In the Elven realm, you have graceful yet dangerous opponents with ranged attacks, fast movement and daring.

In the Dwarven realm, your army is solidly built with determined fighters that can withstand almost any assault.

The Human realm is a versatile army that can adapt to many situations.

The Orcs are heavy hitting and numerous.

The Dark Realm relies on fear and terror.

160154.description:
街コロシャープ (which translates as "Machi Koro Sharp") expands the Machi Koro base game with thirteen new establishment cards, including a winery, a moving company and a general store. The designer notes that the new cards somewhat increase the difficulty of the rules, and this expansion can be combined with Machi Koro: Harbor Expansion.

街コロシャープ contains 72 cards: six copies each of the ten red, blue, and green establishments and four copies each of the three purple major establishments.
160154.name: Machi Koro: Millionaire's Row

160155.name: Beyond All Worlds
160155.description:
From publisher blurb:

You don’t think Hell is real? That it can’t exist? That such an outmoded, antiquated concept born of superstition and fear has no place in the Ninth World? Then you are a fool. Hell is real. It exists. And I’ve been there. Don’t believe me? Come. I will show you the gates.

A gruesome portal lies not far into the wilderness. Sometimes, those who have happened upon it swear they heard moaning, crying, and more frightening noises. Locals believe it leads to Hell itself—after all, what else could it be? Those cast into it—criminals, murderers, and other villains—have never been seen again.

What will the PCs discover when they find themselves on the portal’s other side?

Beyond All Worlds is a 22-page adventure for denizens of the Ninth World, preferably of second-tier or higher.

160156.name: Magna Carta
160156.description:
Magna Carta is a casual two-player card game with a medieval theme sporting easy to learn and play rules.

The players take turns drawing cards from a common draw pile, deploying troop cards, supporters cards and resources cards from their hand to the table in front of them and then attacking the opponent cards with the cards on the table.
Each attack determines the number of cards the attacker draws from the draw pile as victory spoils.
When the draw pile is exhausted, the game ends and the player with the most victory spoils wins.

The game includes 90 cards with various units like Infantry, Cavaly e t c, support cards like Fortress, Blacksmith e t c. Resources are the same cards but played face down.
Several special units and supporters exist with special abilities which affects game play.
Each troop/supporter card has deployment requirements, meaning that you need to deploy them in the right order.

160160.name: Inchoate
160160.description:
Designer's description:

Cancer, terrorism, economic collapse, high fructose corn syrup. Everything is fine. Not your problem. You want Heaven. You know for a fact that prayer won’t work, but anything else goes. Virtual reality, sex, drugs, murder, all just means to an end. Whatever it takes to get to the truth. So few of them are worth the trouble. You never paid attention to their chatter. Termites in the pews.

Your single-minded pursuit of the unattainable: asymptotic progression towards a crystalline bliss. Decades of cruelty, blood-soaked rituals, ancient tomes, silent vigils in standing stones, hangovers. They called you a lunatic and a junkie, but you're so much worse than that. You're making progress. After you uncoupled prosaic notions of morality from your quest for actual reality, it became art. Do unto others the way they need to get done.

Inchoate is a Fiasco playset with new rules for Tilt and Aftermath.

160162.name: Arcana Journal (Issue 60 - May 2014)
rpgissuearticle: Magi of the Age of Rebirth
The Red Raven Tavern and Inn
160162.description:
From publisher blurb:

The true wonders of Arcana are explored in the monthly journals. Each issue focuses on a hex or faction within the game world, offering rumors, hidden lore, and detailed descriptions of all the important sites and people. Full-color maps (also offered in print-easy black and white) are provided, plus all sites of worthwhile note, such as towns and major adventure sites. Floor plans of castles and other location are also offered.

In addition to this detailed write-up, each issue will also focus on other aspects of the game world, its history, important people, the Magi and gaming classes. When you add it all up, these journals take the mundane and make it magical. It is through the journals that the Arcana game world will grow, expand, and become a living place of adventure.

This issue of the Journal will cover the following aspects of the game world.

House Moorcock
Macabre Magic
Magi of the Age of Rebirth Part 2
Red Raven Tavern
Dress of the South

160163.name: Paths Of The Lil
160163.description:
user summary
Paths of the Lil is a short scenario with a new creature for Gamma World (1st Edition). It was originally published in White Dwarf, Issue 16. This version is a reproduction by Post Apocalyptic Forge fansite members under the auspices of James M. Ward, the original author.

The Lil are a fairy-like creature and the scenario is a location-based encounter with a Lil bramble patch.

160164.description:
Objective: Be the first finishing a round trip though the city (space 1 - 100); learn more about traffic rules.
- moving by turns -
each player moves forward according die roll; ending on a red marked space tell gamemaster/other players what to do if you see this traffic sign.
note:
published during 1930's (increasing traffic); large box shows Nazi emblem Hakenkreuz; cute pewter pawns.
160164.name: Mensch paß auf!

160165.name: The Compound
160165.description:
from the Introduction:
The Compound is intended to be a generic mini-adventure and set of floorplans for use in a modern or post-apocalyptic setting. The site could easily be used by pc's as a permanent or temporary base of operations for further adventures.

website blurb:
A mini-adventure with a set of floorplans for a small town's civil authorities. Includes county administrative offices, a clinic/hospital, and a police station with garage. The map was created using Dungeon Crafter and a custom tile set. This set is used in the scenario pack 2: MA6 for those interested.

user summary:
This scenario expansion is distributed as a zip-compressed archive containing a map key and scenario PDF and 11 maps in JPG format.

160166.name: Master's of the Earth Campaign Scenario Pack 1
160166.description:
from the introduction:
The world has seen better days. Life is harsh and unmerciful. Roving bands of mutated animals and Men compete with the ancestors of the ancients for survival in a world gone mad. It’s now two hundred years after the end of The Black Days and its time that civilization crawled forth from the devastated remains of great nations to claim the Earth once again. Your mission, should you choose to accept it, is to be the vanguard of a new breed of adventuring restorationists. You have been chosen by a rigorous system of trials to form a team that will win back the world and tame it no matter the cost.

This scenario pack contains three beginning level scenarios intended for use with the Gamma World™ role-playing game (3rd Ed.) and the Master’s of the Earth Campaign Background, though they could potentially be used in any campaign with place name modifications.

website blurb:
Intended for beginning level PCs. 3 individual modules

user summary:
The first three scenarios of the Masters of the Earth campaign:
Scenario MA-1: The Trials
Scenario MA-2: The Town of Boze
Scenario MA-3: Shadow Wars

160167.name: Master's of the Earth Campaign Scenario Pack 2
160167.description:
from the introduction:
The world has seen better days. Life is harsh and unmerciful. Roving bands of mutated animals and Men compete with the ancestors of the ancients for survival in a world gone mad. It’s now two hundred years after the end of The Black Days and its time that civilization crawled forth from the devastated remains of great nations to claim the Earth once again. Your mission, should you choose to accept it, is to be the vanguard of a new breed of adventuring restorationists. You have been chosen by a rigorous system of trials to form a team that will win back the world and tame it no matter the cost.

This scenario pack contains three beginning level scenarios intended for use with the Gamma World™ role-playing game (3rd Ed.) and the Master’s of the Earth Campaign Background, though they could potentially be used in any campaign with place name modifications.

website blurb:
A continuation of the storyline in Scenario Pack 1. 3 individual modules.

user comment:
The second part of the Masters of the Earth Campaign. Consists of three linked scenarios in one document:
Scenario MA-4: To the Rescue
Scenario MA-5: The Savage Beast
Scenario MA-6: Burnz, City of the Ancients

An additional scenario pack is available to supplement Scenario MA-6

160168.name: Kitsune
160168.description:
From publisher blurb:

The mischievous spirits of the forests called Kitsune have enraptured and bedeviled the Tatakama’s mortal men and women for centuries. Kitsune begin their lives as ordinary field foxes, but those who are clever and survive fifty years of thefts, chases and daring exploits undergo a startling transformation. As the first moon’s light of their fiftieth year touches the fox, its fur recedes, revealing milk white skin, its paws become larcenous hands and its thoughts become those of a human’s.

Kitsune like nothing better than tempting priests from their vows, dragging heroes on tavern crawls lasting weeks, and otherwise thumbing their noses at stodgy human laws and custom. Though mischievous and more than a little greedy, Kitsune enjoy the company of humans, and often spend decades among human friends and lovers. Most are fairly good hearted, and will take time out from their schemes and carousing to put an end to predatory oni they encounter. Kitsune have always protected humanity, whether or not humans want this protection, and consider their thefts to be fair repayment for their courage.

160169.name: Clover Island
160169.description:
From publisher blurb:

This setting was used in the F series and like Corsair Bay, it was used as an area for multiple adventure opportunities as well as a semi-safe haven. The main community is home to the Pirate King Hannibal the Black. This community is offered as a free download! One of the adventures off the island is the Quest for the Golden Rose involving the sunken ship. With a multitude of side adventures this area helps mid-level adventurers increase their experience point base.

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for mid to upper level groups of adventurers. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for several one shot adventures or a continuing campaign setting!

160170.name: Reise durch deutsche Großstadte
160170.description:
Objective: Starting in Berlin be the first finishing a round trip through Germany. Learn more about the big cities of Germany.
- moving by turns -
each player moves forward according die roll; ending on a white space (city) follow instructions.

note:
likely published during 1920s

160171.name: 101 City & Place Names
160171.description:
From the publisher blurb:

The following list is intended to be a generic starting point in coming up with city, place or planet names suitable for most settings.

160172.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 1, Issue 1 - People Sematary)
160172.description:
From publisher blurb:

People Sematary

This great first issue offers a wild low-level adventure filled with zombies, graveyards and robots. The issue also comes with full color battle tiles of the graveyard and figure flats for the adventure.

160173.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 1, Issue 2 - Blackjack)
160173.description:
From publisher blurb:

Blackjack

This issue we have a bad hero because sometimes you have to be bad to be good. The issue also comes with police officer figure flats.

160174.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 1, Issue 3 - Arch Mage)
160174.description:
From publisher blurb:

Arch Mage Advanced Class

This week's issue details a new advanced class, the Arch Mage. Got a magic based hero, well here you can make them even more magical and increase their lore in the arcane arts. This issue also comes with a set of full color graveyard battle tiles.

160175.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 1, Issue 4 - Power Division)
160175.description:
From publisher blurb:

Power Division

This time around we have the secret government organization known as Power Division. Super heroes need watching and the agents of Power Division have the job of doing just that. The issue comes with full color figure flats of the agents who work for this organization.

160176.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 1, Issue 5 - Mask Hunters)
160176.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mask Hunters

A great mid-level adventure is outlined for you this week with a bunch of killer assassin hero hunters. Can your heroes avoid becoming the next trophy? This issue comes complete with all the full color figure flats needed for the adventure.

160177.name: Curse of the Demon's Gold
160177.description:
From publisher blurb:

A great adventure for your heroes, see what happens when a band of high tech pirates comes into possession of an old cursed coin. Can your heroes save the day?

This adventure for use with the Heroes Wear Masks RPG system comes with everything you need to run the adventure as well as figure flats of all the characters you will encounter in the game.

Try this and adventures for the HWM system and have a heroic time.

160178.name: Freak Nation
160178.description:
From publisher blurb:

Were do all the freaks go, why to your town so your super heroes can have new villains to beat up on. But are they villains?

This adventure for use with the Heroes Wear Masks RPG system comes with everything you need to run the adventure as well as figure flats of all the characters you will encounter in the game.

Try this and adventures for the HWM system and have a heroic time.

160179.name: God in the Machine
160179.description:
From publisher blurb:

High tech villains looking to be more then human.

This adventure for use with the Heroes Wear Masks RPG system comes with everything you need to run the adventure as well as figure flats of all the characters you will encounter in the game.

Try this and adventures for the HWM system and have a heroic time.

160182.name: SUP3: Psionics of Lore
rpg: Blood & Treasure Fantasy Role Playing Game
160182.description:
From the introduction:
Psychics, mesmerists, mentalists, psions, wyrds, etc.: Psionic characters have long been a tradition in modern media. From the mystic knights of science fiction to the psychics of cyberpunk, mental powers even transcend to fantasy. Thus, I give you Psionics
of Lore, a supplement for the Blood & Treasure roleplaying game meant to inject psionic powers into your fantasy world.

160183.name: Tip Top Clap
160183.description:
From the Box: A succession of noises and mimes is created and added to at the game's pace...Laughs guaranteed for this original memory game!

Players draw from 32 cards with icons of noises and mimes and turn the cards over. The active player has to do all the noises and mimes of the already drawn cards in the right order. When a player has got it wrong, he takes a turned over card as a penalty card.
The winner is the player who has the least penalty cards.

160184.name: Mercenary Second Edition
160184.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the universes of Traveller there are countless souls sailing across the sea of stars in search of fame, fortune and perhaps some deeper meaning to it all. Some are looking for the answer to the eternal questions of their civilisation, others simply want to get away from it all and find something better in the void. Anything can happen in the stretches of emptiness between worlds, and sometimes this can mean trouble. For the unprepared, this is often fatal. If someone cannot protect themselves from the dangers of the universe, there are always others who will – for a price.

This all new edition of Book 1: Mercenary provides a great many rules and revisions suitable for all ground-based combat in any Traveller campaign. With this book, you will be able to;

Recruit squads, platoons, companies and entire armies from across the stars to create your own force of mercenaries.
Engage in massed battles between these forces using a new system that is just as quick as combat between individual characters!
Take your character through university and higher education before embarking on a career.
Wield the all new Destructive weaponry to annihilate any foe you meet on the battlefield, while using forward observers to rain artillery and orbital fire down upon them.
Use the all new ticket system to pick up mercenary contracts and earn massive amounts of Credits.
Build strongholds, fortresses and bunker complexes, and then engage in sieges and assaults to destroy them.
Learn the secrets of bulk-buying huge amounts of weapons at a discount, and pick up some new vehicles designed specifically for mercenaries along the way.
Apply the new gun combat skills and revisions to your games for a greatly enhanced battle experience.

160185.name: Mythic Sphinxes
160185.description:
From publisher blurb:

Paragons of Wisdom and Might!

The majestic sphinx is more than just a symbol of the ancient lands of the Nile. It is a symbol of power and wisdom, a guardian that stands throughout the ages. Sphinxes have a long history in fantasy roleplaying games, and several distinct breeds have shown up throughout the years, but Mythic Adventures provides only a single mythic sphinx to work with.

This book provides two more mythic sphinxes, each with several never-before-seen powers an abilities. The guardian sphinx, who takes its role as a guardian of important people and objects very seriously, and is magically able to shroud creatures and objects from detection—even if they’re buildings the size of mountains! It can also levy its powerful guardian’s riddle to foil would-be tomb raiders, who must answer correctly or be trapped in an extraplanar hell. Its roar is so mighty that it panics even the greatest of warriors, and saps the strength from those who hear it. And if all that fails, the guardian sphinx still has several other tricks up its sleeve.

The Nile sphinx is somewhat different: a colossal sphinx-shaped construct made of immense blocks of sandstone. It, too, employs a magical riddle that dooms those who are unable to answer it, but it also has power over time, halting it for the sake of itself and allies, or speeding it up to age foes into oblivion, among other dangerous abilities.

Finally, there is a brief discussion on handling riddles at the table, which provides some helpful guidelines for ways in which to use ability and skill checks to adjudicate such circumstances, and also provides several sample riddles.

160186.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 1, Issue 6 - Cerebra)
160186.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cerebra

This week we have a great NPC with a troubled past. Can your heroes help or will they have to hunt down the escaped Cerebra before she kills again. Comes with some great figure flats including some soldiers for your super games.

160187.name: Pinehurst 2 America's Famous Course
160187.description:
From the game instructions

Designed to be the most realistic computer golf game available Three views of each hole, Overhead and side views of shots, Augmented color graphics, Complete bag of clubs, Hooks and Slices, Non-level greens, Trees, Bushes, Water, Rough and Sand.

1 to 4 players can play from Regular or Championship tees.

Before you can hit your shot you have to make the same decisions that you have to make on the golf course: What direction to hit the ball, Which club to use, how hard to swing and whether to hook or slice the ball. you enter these decisions by selecting one character commands and keying in your choices.

All the games in the Golf's Best/Play Golf series have the same features, use the same control scheme and have very similar graphics. They are all stand alone games that feature different real world courses.

160188.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 1, Issue 7 - New Powers)
160188.description:
From publisher blurb:

New Powers

How about some new powers for your HWM game. We have a nice list of new super powers for you to play with. This issue also comes with a new set of rooftop battles tiles on which, well to wage super battles on.

160189.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 1, Issue 8 - Danger International)
160189.description:
From publisher blurb:

Danger International

This issue we have the folks of Danger Inc, a great bunch of NPCs who can add a twist to your games. The issue of course comes with full color figure flats of the organization's agents and main characters,

160190.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 1, Issue 9 - Monster Island)
160190.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Mystery of Monster Island

This issue we take you on a dinosaur filled adventure with this mid-level adventure. The issue comes with new jungle filled battle tiles and figure flats to play the adventure.

160191.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 1, Issue 10 - Odysseus)
160191.description:
From publisher blurb:

Odysseus

Some heroes just can't stay away, so here is the legend himself, a great new NPC for the HWM system. Also included are some skeleton figure flats to battle.

160192.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 1, Issue 11 - Arch Foe)
160192.description:
From publisher blurb:

Arch Foe Advanced Class

Need a really bad guy, well the Arch Foe advance class can fit the bill. Included are several new street level battle tiles to fight your new arch foes on.

160193.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 1, Issue 12 - Inner Earth)
160193.description:
From publisher blurb:

Inner Earth Empire

Lets take a trip under the earth this issue with the Inner Earth Empire. A great setting for your heroes to explore and find adventures. This issue also comes with new figure flats just for this location.

160194.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 1, Issue 13 - Tomb of Robot King)
160194.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tomb of the Robot King

An ancient tomb with more then you expected. This is a great mid-level adventure so get your robot kicking boots on, you will need them. This issue of course comes with all the battle tiles and figure flats you will need to play the game.

160195.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 1, Issue 14 - Doctor Mutation)
160195.description:
From publisher blurb:

Doctor Mutation

Here's a wild NPC for your HWM games, the mad Doctor Mutation. Can your heroes survive his mad plans? This issue comes with the mad Doctor's figure flat and some mutant victims.

160196.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 1, Issue 15 - New Feats)
160196.description:
From publisher blurb:

New Feats

New super feats for you in this issue. Take your super games to new levels with these great new feats for HWM. This issue also comes with some basic crypt battle tiles.

160197.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 1, Issue 16 - Viper Corp.)
160197.description:
From publisher blurb:

Viper

Most games are not complete unless you have some evil ninjas in them. Well, the Viper Ninjas fit the bill just fine. This issue also comes with a ton of Viper Ninja figures to use in the game.

160198.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 1, Issue 17 - Jail Break)
160198.description:
From publisher blurb:

Jail Break

How about an evil super-villain adventure this time around? You and your nasty team of villains need to break a fellow out of jail, can you pull it off?

160199.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 1, Issue 18 - The Machine)
160199.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Machine

An alien machine of great power wants to destroy all organic life on our world! Of course it’s the heroes’ job to stop it.

160200.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 1, Issue 19 - The Mentor)
160200.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Mentor

This week we have the advanced class, the Mentor. Need a patron or teacher for your young superhero team? The mentor can teach all sorts of powers and tricks, and may come in handy for any superhero team or game.

160201.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 1, Issue 20 - Purity Corps)
160201.description:
From publisher blurb:

Purity Corps

Some anti-mutant protestors turn into a real threat for mutants of all kinds.

160202.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 1, Issue 21 - Save the Day)
160202.description:
From publisher blurb:

Save the Day

What do you do when a heroes does the right thing the wrong way? A great adventure waits for those willing to answer that question.

160203.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 1, Issue 22 - The Professor)
160203.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Professor

Some villains are not so much dangerous as a pain to have around. The Professor of Crime is such a foe. Also included in this issue are the Professor’s Figure Flat and some Swat Cops.

160204.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 1, Issue 23 - New Resource Items)
160204.description:
From publisher blurb:

New Resource Items

New gear to fight crime with or to commit that great heist. This issue also comes with new battle tiles to form a great park to fight super brawls within.

160205.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 1, Issue 24 - The Shadow)
160205.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Shadow

Those that know of the Shadow fear their power. Those that fight the Shadow end up dead. A great organization to add to your super games this week. We also have some great wizard figure flats for your super battles.

160206.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 2, Issue 1 - Alien Abduction)
160206.description:
From publisher blurb:

Alien Abduction

A different take on the alien abduction story, this time the alien is in danger of being probed…

160207.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 3, Issue 1 - The Trouble with Trinkets)
160207.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Trouble with Trinkets

This week’s adventure has the heroes dealing with a creepy cult and a sea monster. Comes with a series of Dock Battle Tile.

160208.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 4, Issue 1 - Heroes Who Drive)
160208.description:
From publisher blurb:

Heroes Who Drive

New Rules for creating super cars!! As well as some great super car counters.

160209.name: The Last Stand 2
160209.description:
User Summary

The second entry in The Last Stand series, The Last Stand 2 sees you again take the role of Jack, a survivor of a zombie apocalypse. You have 40 days to make it to Union City or else you will miss the final evacuation.

During each game day you allocate resources to strengthening barricades and exploring buildings in your location; during each night phase the zombies attack and you must kill them before they overwhelm you. More powerful weapons can be found as the game progresses however the zombie onslaughts also become tougher.

160210.name: The Last Stand
160210.description:
User Summary

In The Last Stand you must survive 20 nights of zombie attacks. By day you are able to allocate resources to search for other survivors or better weapons, and rebuild your barricades. Each night you fight to kill a tide of zombies who are attempting to overwhelm your defence wall and eat you.

160211.name: War of Ashes: Shieldbash
160211.description:
The War of Ashes is not a war of front lines and set piece battles. Small groups encounter each other in every manner, and there can be neither truce nor quarter. Scouts and foraging parties, messengers, guards, and lost soldiers meet. They fight over a cache of food, a lost animal, a footbridge, a message, or just to get back home. These desperate skirmishes take place amongst camps and baggage, in ravines, at the edge of swamps, or on the decks of small ships. There is no warning and no time to call for help. These small battles that will never be named or recorded are decided by the choices and skill of a handful of fighters, and in turn these skirmishes decide the course of the war.

Shieldbash is the skirmish wargame for the War of Ashes setting. The fights are very flavorful, with ships that move beneath you as you fight on their decks, cavalry, darkness, archers, musicians, berserkers, carnivorous plants, and lumbering trolls.

Two new races of Agaptus are introduced in Shieldbash: the lizard-like Ki-Kak seeking vengeance on the Vidaar, and the True Atronians, does from the Elvorix, Vidaar, and Jaarl people who fight to unify their peoples against the Kuld menace.

A blind activation system leaves the commander unsure of how far he can push his fighters before the momentum of battle changes. Shieldbash concentrates on a commander's ability to use his fighters to best effect. Designed for ease of play, commanders can fight several skirmishes in an evening, following the tale of their warbands as they grow in power and renown. Gather your fighters, plan your attack, and fight for your people. Lead with your sword, keeping an eye open for the errant Shieldbash!

160213.name: Amstrad Module MP-1/MP-2
160213.description:
A TV-modulator and power supply by Amstrad for the classic CPC-computers.

If you bought an Amstrad CPC together with one of the Amstrad GT64/GT65 Green Monitors however, you might have wanted the ability to play games on the colour TV-set later, so Amstrad also made the MP-1/MP-2 devices. They provided the power needed by the CPCs, so that you didn't have to carry the monitor around just to have power, and a TV-modulator which modulated the monitor signal in a way that it could be seen on a regular TV-set.

The difference between the MP-1 and MP-2 models is just the additional 12V power supply for the CPC664/CPC6128's disk drive in the later model.

Source: CPCwiki.

160217.name: Jewels of the Sultan
160217.description:
The goal of this game is to acquire the color jewels that will score in the present round, as well as in future rounds until all jewels have been dispersed and the game ends after the final round. However, you don't want any of the white colored jewels, as they are worthless and will never score.

(Setup) From Box Top:
Put all of the jewels into a global stash to one side of the playing area. Give each player a Persian Rug. Choose one player to be the first Sultan. Give that player the Sultan pawn, the Sultan cards, and the dice.

(Play) Summarized From the Box Top:
The Sultan, using the dice, adds 10 jewels of the rolled color into a single pile for that round. The Sultan then divides the pile in any manner they choose among each of the players, so long as each player pile contains at least one item. Finally the sultan secretly determines which color will score at the end of the given round using the Sultan cards. The position of the Sultan then passes to the next player, and play continues until all jewels have been dispersed and final scoring occurs.

160218.name: Rise 2: Resurrection
160218.description:
Rise 2: Resurrection is a computer game developed by Mirage Media and published by Acclaim Entertainment in 1996. The game is a sequel to Rise of the Robots, and improves on the first game's graphics, rendering and animation; hits now give off metal scraps and electrical arcs progressively run over the bodies of damaged robots.

Unlike its predecessor, Resurrection allows the players to control any robot, both in one and two-player mode. Also, players can choose from 256 different palette rotations for each robot. There are five different types of projectiles available to each robot.

The game features a far broader fighting experience than its predecessor. Each robot has its own original moves, Mortal Kombat-inspired death moves, the ability to steal and use a defeated robot projectile, and a devastating super move that can be used when the power bar is full, similar to other fighting games of the time. The game also features a combo counter system, named Chaos. The controls are standard for a fighting game, and non-humanoïd robots adapt their moves to the punch/kick model.

In one-player mode the player faces each robot in its own rendered and raytraced stage, while two-player mode allows the player to either choose the stage or to leave it at random. Each stage is graphically tuned to its corresponding robot, and some stages feature traps that players can use to gain an advantage against their opponent. The traps also tend to match their owner robot's characteristics: as the stage for Steppenwolf, the gun-wielding robot, features a trap that fires bullets, and the stage for Vandal, the saw-wielding robot, features a trap with a saw.

Source: Wikipedia, "Rise 2: Resurrection", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

160219.name: Rings of the Magi
160219.description:
User Summary

Rings of the Magi is a puzzle game in which the player works to remove all of the coloured rings from the wooden board by locating them all proximal to their respective colours. Rings are moved by pressing the arrow buttons at the perimeter of the board. The challenge is in ensuring that one maintains enough rings of a colour to remove every ring; that is to say, if there are 3 red rings, making a pair of 2 rings and removing only 2 red rings will make the board impossible to solve.

160220.name: Robomaze II
160220.description:
User Summary

Robomaze II is a 2D platformer in which the protagonist, a robot, works through a series of levels inhabited by enemies, obstacles, money, and various other items. He carries a gun that can shoot an unlimited number of bullets, but only one bullet at a time can be on the screen. Most levels are conquered by reaching a gap in the top of the level which leads the robot onto the bottom of the next level. Points are awarded for progress and for collecting money, which is placed in more locations that are more difficult to reach.

160221.name: Robomaze III
160221.description:
User Summary

Robomaze III is an entirely different style of game from Robomaze II, despite that it continues the story of the robotic protagonist. This instalment begins with the flight of the robot from the tower of the mad scientist in Robomaze II, but he left his gun behind and is now weaponless. In this more open world, the robot embarks on a quest, complete with monsters, quests, helpful wisemen, and other adventure RPG type games. The game no longer involves the 2D levels of the previous game, but a more open 2D world with doors and passages to each new area.

160223.name: A Problem at Formid
160223.description:
From the adventure's background section:

This adventure is designed for the ALTERNITY® game and takes place in a futuristic PL 7 space-opera setting. It can be adapted for the STAR*DRIVE™ Campaign Setting with few changes.

Formid Station is a research and observation facility located in orbit around the planet Formid Prime, located in a system several light years from Earth. The station is owned by Vector Developments, a privately owned Earth-based corporation. It was designed to gather information on Formid Prime and monitor the activities of the various indigenous lifeforms to determine whether the world could support human colonies without significantly impacting the global ecology. The station was intended to relay planetary readings back to Earth every 48 hours. However, as might be expected, there is a problem.

All transmissions from the station ceased two months ago, and attempts to contact the station’s research team have failed. The heroes are sent to investigate.

160224.name: Hunters and Collectors
160224.description:
From the adventure background:

“Hunters and Collectors” is a short ALTERNITY® adventure set in a generic PL 7 campaign universe, although it works as well in PL 6 settings. The adventure is best played with 3–5 heroes. All of the supporting cast members are human, and it is assumed that the heroes are human as well, although other species can be introduced easily enough.

160225.name: Nest
160225.description:
From the adventure background:

a Star*Drive mini-scenario

The heroes discover a hostile infiltration of a remote mining settlement and eliminate a growing External menace to the system.
The encounter presents different levels of challenge appropriate for a pre-generated or starting group (assorted characters equipped with light weapons and a civilian vessel, such as a trader) or more capable parties (one or more characters trained with heavy weapons or body tanks and a ship with better maneuverability and weapons, such as a considerably modified trader, or a scout similar to CSS Shrike as described in Red Starrise).

160226.name: Gridcasts 01,  Star*Drive TVN Reports
160226.description:
From the Forward:

In the tradition of all the great products released for the Star*Drive Campaign setting, this free online product
attempts to carry forward with a series of fictional news reports for Gamemasters to use as they see fit. They originally appeared on the official Star*Drive fansite, Tequila Starrise, and now appear with additional sidebar material in this publication.

New adventure hooks, supporting cast members, alien adversaries, and a variety of other ideas all crept into the
making of Gridcasts. This represents the fi rst volume of what may eventually become a collection of supplements similar to the Alien Compendium, Star Compendium, and Threats From Beyond. All of these resources increased the appeal of the Star*Drive game, adding flavor and richness to a campaign setting that already holds everything sci-fi gamers could ever desire. Hopefully, Gridcasts can live alongside them.

In that regard, these TVN reports all attempt to stay as true to Star*Drive source material as possible. Every effort was made to research and verify any references to original Star*Drive facts revealed in the earlier products published by Wizards of the Coast. This should help Gamemasters to more easily integrate them within their ongoing campaigns. It is also recommended that special attention be paid to the dates that accompany each TVN report for an idea of where it falls within the greater Star*Drive timeline.

160227.name: Chaos Ninjas
160227.description:
Chaos Ninjas is a light card game that combines both strategy and take-that elements.
In Chaos Ninjas you play the role of a Warlord who is hiring Ninjas.
You are trying to be the first player to have six unique Defender Ninjas in front of your play area.
On your turn you only perform one action, either take a card or play a card.
Very easy to learn and easy to play.

160228.name: fehde
160228.description:
A tactical game for two.
Your goal is to capture the enemies knight, represented by a spherical peg. You start the game with the Knight in the front row, pawns are beside and behind him. Movement is one field in any direction by any playing piece. Capturing is done by jumping over enemy pieces which is in case a must. Pawns are only allowed to move in your own territory and the neutral area of the board, knights can move anywhere. Pawn are aloud to jump over pieces that are placed on the corner spaces of the enemy territory when they land in the neutral area.

160229.name: Sboura Destinations
160229.description:
The name "Sboura" comes from the Greek word for "a spinning top" and included in the game is a numbered spiiner that's used to determine which cards are picked from a deck of destination cards.

Players will enjoy hours of educational fun testing their knowledge and counting skills by answering the many questions asked on the game cards while collecting, paying out and trading Sboura points for each card.

There is, of course, a hitch! Within the card desk, there are 16 cards that contain NO questions. These cards have some strange characters that will give instructions that MUST BE FOLLOWED, some will help you, others will definitely not.

It is basically a trivia game. At the start of the game you start with 544 dollars (yes, 544) you then put 100 dollars in the pot. The first player rolls the dreidel (yup, it's a dreidel with numbers on it). The spinner then gets asked 3 questions, each one harder than the last. For each one they get right, they get money out of the pot corresponding to the amount shown on the card for the question. If they get it wrong, they pay the amount shown on the card to the pot. When the pot is empty, the game is over. The most dollars at the end of the game wins.

160230.name: Musta Maija
160230.description:
A traditional Finnish card game, based on Russian Durak. The goal of the game is to shed cards. On each turn, the active player ("attacker") plays any number of cards in one suit to next player ("defender"). The defender may beat them by playing cards from her hand, either higher cards in the same suit or any cards in the trump suit.

Queen of Spades (aka Musta Maija or Black Mary) cannot be beaten or used to beat anything. As long as there's talon left, players fill their cards to five cards after each turn. Once the talon runs out, the players who get rid of their cards exit the game. The player who is left with the Queen of Spades is the loser.

160232.name: PrinciPals
160232.description:
PrinciPals is a 2 player cardgame where you try to be the first principal to get 3 full classes of students. Or be the one with the most classes.

It's a microgame which means few components but still meaningfull decisions to be made.

Do you use the student card for it's action or do you play it in your class for its number of students...

160233.name: Wizards Mutants Lazer Pistols (Issue 6 - May 2014)
160233.description:
Wizards Mutants Lazer Pistols
Issue #6
May 2014

Cover art by Dr. Brainus Mangenius, Psy D.

160234.name: 1750: Britain vs. France
boardgamepodcastepisode: Dice Tower News 309 - September 19, 2014
160234.description:
Throughout the 18th century, Britain and France waged a bloody series of wars for nothing short of global domination. Massive sailing warships, armies of bayonet-wielding soldiers, and their skilled allies fought for control of North American, African, and Indian colonies. In many ways, this was the first "world war".

In 1750: Britain vs. France, you play as Britain or France, wielding your forces to decide the outcome of this struggle. During the game, you recruit generals and admirals from the Seven Years' War (French and Indian War) and the War of the Austrian Succession, and send other military forces to take colonies by force, with colonies producing exports to aid your economy. Your units roll dice in combat against enemy forces, and you can modify those results by playing historic event cards to turn the tide of battle, modifying dice rolls and destroying enemy cards at critical moments. You'll also engage in political efforts to persuade other world powers to enter the conflict on your side and bring their resources to the fight.

Your final score is decided by the number of colonies you have captured, countries you have gotten to join your cause, and enemy leaders you've taken as prisoners. Will you change history, or will history repeat itself?

160235.name: Scramble
160235.description:
User Summary

Scramble is a DOS version of the popular board game, Scrabble. Points awarded per letter used and can be modified with the bonus slots on the board. Up to four players can play a game, and computer players may be included.

160237.name: Evony
160237.description:
User Summary

Evony (formerly known as Civony) is an Adobe Flash-based multiplayer online game with graphic elements reminiscent of other similar real time games, however there is no cultural diversity and the buildings and units are very limited. The game is set in medieval times, where a player is to establish a city, begin developing various technologies, and build supporting structures and alliances to generate armies and resources for the purpose of attacking other players and computer generated cities.

160238.description: Supplement for Confrontation: the Age of the Rag'narok that contains additional rules for playing with the Temple (Griffin) Army and its associated artifacts, miracles and spells.
160238.name: Confrontation: Temple Army Book
boardgameexpansion: Confrontation: The Age of the Rag'Narok

160240.name: Scubaman's Quest
160240.description:
User Summary

Scubaman's Quest is a side scrolling ocean game in which the protagonist, Scubaman, searches for treasure under the sea. There are many locations, including places such as a shipwreck, 'Posidonia' - the home of the mermaids - and more. Scubaman has a harpoon gun that can damage enemies and he gains points and powerups by picking up more benign sea creatures and treasure.

160241.description:
The players start as pedestrians. Later they use a bike and a tram. All blue spaces have to be visited. On several spaces the Players have to explain different traffic situations. If the do this rigth they get a point (green marker) awarded. If not they get a red penality marker (negative points). The traffic lights are placed in the center of the game board. At the roll of a 6, the player may adjust the traffic lights or the arms of the traffic cop on the game board to close the road for opposing players.
The winner is not the player who ist the first to get to the finish space, but the player who gets the most points.
160241.name: Mit Köpfchen im Verkehr

160242.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 2, Issue 2 - Monkey C)
160242.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monkey C

Not all heroes are human, some are super monkeys. This issue also comes with some great big bug figure flats.

160243.name: TAU: A storytelling game where everyone dies happily ever after
rpg: TAU: A storytelling game where everyone dies happily ever after
160243.description:
From the Introduction:

Welcome to TAU! At first glance, TAU seems to be a lot of different things: a card game, a role-playing game, and a collaborative storytelling game. The rules for such a game could be ridiculously complicated, but we have pared it down to the simplest elements to make the game easy to learn and to have as few limits as possible on the group's creativity.

TAU is played with communal storytelling, meaning that it does not need pencil, paper, or dice; only the Players' minds are needed to determine outcomes. The game usually starts out with the Players finding their characters facing a series of potentially lethal challenges from which in all likelihood the players' characters will not survive. The winner is the Player of the last Character standing, or at least still alive - plenty of games have been won prone! Remember, TAU (T) is the Greek letter symbolizing death and rebirth. Don't be afraid to take creative and entertaining risks! There's always another round!

These rules are optimized for a group of five: four Players, and one Storyteller.

User added information:

TAU has three phases: the Trick phase, the Character phase, and the Storytelling phase.

The Trick phase is similar to a standard trick-taking game such as Hearts or Spades. Each card in the game contains not only attributes for RPG characters, but also a suit and rank of a standard 52-card deck. Only the Players take part in the Trick phase - the Storyteller never has any cards.

The Character phase consists of the Players taking one card from each trick they won and creating their character with the results. If a player won no tricks, he takes three cards from the discards of the other Players.

The Storytelling phase is the RPG phase. The Storyteller (GM) creates a situation in which the Player Characters are in grave danger. The Players can react with their Character cards, but eventually all will die. The last Player Character alive wins the round, and another round is then dealt out and played through all three phases. Players play as many rounds as desired, but the essence of the game is that all Characters always die!

160244.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 2, Issue 3 - The Archer)
160244.description:
From publisher blurb:

Archer Advanced Class

A great new advanced class this week with the super archer. Let your trick arrow fly and send the bad guys running for cover. This issue comes with a blank Grass Battle Tile to play your super battles on.

160245.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 2, Issue 4 - Crime Unlimited)
160245.description:
From publisher blurb:

Crime Unlimited

All super villains need a death ray, a super car or some super bomb, but not all of them are smart enough to build these things themselves, so they turn to Crime Unlimited for help.

160246.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 2, Issue 5 - Grail Heist)
160246.description:
From publisher blurb:

Grail Heist

The Grail is on display and you need to steal it. A great adventure for super villain or super heroes forced to do something wrong for the right reason. This issue comes with a bunch of figures flats and a battle map of the museum.

160247.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 2, Issue 6 - Guardian of the Doors)
160247.description:
From publisher blurb:

Guardian of the Doors

The Guardian of Doors is a transdimensional entity who is responsible for maintaining the integrity between universes. He closes tears in the fabric of space-time and stops those who would seek to tamper with the dimensional boundaries. Given the nature of his duties and the unique status of Earth as a dimensional nexus he can be commonly found on or around Earth and its many extradimensional counterparts. A great character as a friend of foe, use him to spice up your super games. This issue also comes with the Guardian’s figure flat and some comic horrors to beat up on.

160248.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 2, Issue 7 - Power Feats)
160248.description:
From publisher blurb:

Power Feats

Power Feats allow your heroes to take their super powers to the next level. Based on a set power, these feats add flavor and fun abilities to any super game. This issue also comes with some great new battle tiles.

160249.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 2, Issue 8 - The League of Amazing People)
160249.description:
From publisher blurb:

The League of Amazing People

What happens when old heroes retire? The League of Amazing People is a team of extraordinary individuals founded in the 1920s. A great group of old heroes gets the spot light this issue along with some super dinosaur figures flats.

160250.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 2, Issue 9 - Creature of the Black Lab)
rpgissuearticle: The Creature From the Black Lab
160250.description:
From publisher blurb:

Creature of the Black Lab

This week we have a great adventure with an escaped robot. This issue comes with some great new counters for your game.

160251.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 2, Issue 10 - The Specialist)
160251.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Specialist

This week we have a supernatural Hitman, one that cannot be stopped.

160252.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 2, Issue 11 - Speedster)
160252.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Speedster

Got a super fast hero and but more speed, well we have the Speedster Advanced class here to save the day. This issue also comes with new battle tile.

160253.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 2, Issue 12 - Masters of Terror)
160253.description:
From publisher blurb:

Masters of Terror

The Masters of Terror are an organization of highly trained terrorists-for-hire. Involved in everything from industrial sabotage to political terrorism to false flag operations, whenever the obscenely wealthy want to sew chaos and fear the Masters of Terror are there to provide that service. Unlike traditional terrorist groups who are motivated by a core ideology, the Masters of Terror are in it for the money. They will work for any individual or group who is willing to pay their fees and often play both sides of a conflict against the middle.

160254.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 2, Issue 13 - Amphitheatre on the Thrall Moon of H'ell)
rpgissuearticle: Amphitheatre on the Thrall Moon of H'ell
160254.description:
From publisher blurb:

Amphitheatre on the Thrall Moon of H’ell

This week’s adventure has the heroes being kidnaped and forced to fight to the death in an alien arena. Can they survive and make it home? This issue comes with a full color bettle map of the alien arena and figure flats for all the foes.

160255.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 2, Issue 14 - Land Squid)
160255.description:
From publisher blurb:

Land Squid

Humans are not the only intelligent race on the earth, nope there is a race of squid like folks deep under the ocean and they have sent their envoy. Comes with the Land Squid’s figure flats and some nasty shark people.

160256.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 2, Issue 15 - The Gangster)
160256.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Gangster Advanced Class

Some bad guys are real bad, made men who seek to bring crime to a new level.

160257.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 2, Issue 16 - Star Knights)
160257.description:
From publisher blurb:

Star Knights

Lords of order and law, the Star Knights seek justice and peace throughout the galaxy. This issue comes with full details on this organization as well as several full color figure flats of several star knights.

160258.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 2, Issue 17 - Philosophical Differences)
160258.description:
From publisher blurb:

Philosophical Differences

This week’s adventure has the heroes dealing with bad heroes. What do you do when some real bad guys call themselves heroes?

160259.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 2, Issue 18 - Battle Scarab)
160259.description:
From publisher blurb:

Battle Scarab

13 year old Timmy Buddy has a secret, he is the super hero called the Battle Scarab. This issues also comes with some great retro robots figure flats to battle.

160260.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 2, Issue 19 - Super Scientist)
160260.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Super Scientist Advance Class

A great new advanced class for the game, the super scientist can worked wonders using science and high tech gear.

160261.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 2, Issue 20 - The Ancients)
160261.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Ancients

Some foes come from myth and these mages, monsters and legends just won’t go away. Comes with all the stuff you need to bring this organization to life within your game.

160262.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 2, Issue 21 - The Greenhouse of Doctor X)
160262.description:
From publisher blurb:

Greenhouse of Doctor X

This week’s adventure has the heroes dealing with a creepy garden and its alien master.

160263.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 2, Issue 22 - The Werewolf)
160263.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Warewolf

Nazi assassin, occult leader and all around bad guy, the Warewolf makes a great villain for any games. This issues comes with his figure flats and some Nazi zombies.

160264.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 2, Issue 23 - The Animalist)
160264.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Animalist Advance Class

A great new advanced class for the game, the animalist taps into their inner beast and saves the day.

160265.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 2, Issue 24 - The Elemental Lords)
160265.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Elemental Lords

A group of powerful mages who tap into the true fire of magic. Can your heroes defeat them and the elemental slaves?

160266.name: The Linkworlds Cluster
160266.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Linkworlds Cluster is a complete gate setting designed for use with T20 or T20 Lite. The Linkworlds (are located in Ley Sector of Gateway Domain, a region covered in the forthcoming Gateway Domain Sourcebook from QLI. Thus everything in this setting is compatible with future T20 product releases. The setting can of course be used with other rule sets.

160267.name: Mass Effect: Andromeda
videogamehonor: 2015 Global Game Awards Most Anticipated Game Next Year Winner
2016 Global Game Awards Most Anticipated Game Next Year Winner
2016 Golden Joystick Most Wanted Game Next Year Winner
2016 The Game Awards Most Anticipated Game Next Year Nominee
160267.description:
User Summary

Mass Effect 4 will not feature Shepard and his/her companions may make a cameo appearance. The game will focus more on exploration in another galaxy and finding suitable planets for human colonization. There will be new alien races and the story will not necessarily relate to any of the events from the first three games.

160268.name: Modern Player's Guide
160268.description:
From publisher blurb:

The World we live in provides the stage for all sorts of action
pact stories. These tales of cops and robbers, sleuths and spies, and other forms of modern action constantly play out in people’s imagination. With that premise in mind, we present this book that allows you to craft a contemporary setting of your very own, populated by evil villains and desperate situations that call upon the very best your heroes have to offer.
