It’s a game of your imagination where you get to tell stories by taking on the rolls of the characters that you create. It’s a game that offers a multitude of choices – more choices than even the most sophisticated computer game, because the only limit to what you can do is what you can imagine. The story unfolds like a movie, except all the action takes place within your own imagination.

This volume, the Modern Campaign Setting for the 4th edition of Dungeons & Dragons® game, offers a wealth of new character options, including a new race and new classes, new skills, and new feats. It introduces the craft power source used by the Smart Hero, along with a new approach to summoning creatures.

Chapter 1 introduces a new race for a high tech campaign world. The Robot makes its début within these pages and provides different options depending on the Progress Level of the campaign. Six new classes make up most of chapter 2. These classes are the Charismatic Hero, Fast Hero, Psychic Hero, Smart Hero, Strong Hero, and the Tough Hero. To add a bit a flare new hybrid classes are also given for each of the main classes for this book, and are compatible with the fantasy setting hybrid classes for more customization. Also in this chapter are 6 new epic destinies that take full advantage of a modern setting and allow your imagination to take off.

Chapter 3 includes a variety of new options for characters of every class. First are new skills that allow a character to fully interact with the modern world, and additions to older skills found in the Players Handbook. New feats provide additional opportunities for characters to specialize and customize their characters to fully obtain what they had envisioned for it. New backgrounds called occupations that better reflect a modern environment are also present and provide the players the ability to adjust their character in more subtle ways. New to the 4thedition setting but found in earlier settings, Leadership and Reputation make a comeback and allow players to fully realize the true power of a modern campaign. Leadership and reputation are also compatible with the fantasy version of 4thedition in order to bring something new to the table.

The meat and bones of chapter 4 are the weapons and equipment for all progress levels. New to the 4th edition system is the Gadget and Upgrade system which allows Players and Dungeon Masters the ability to fully customize a weapons and equipment from scratch or simply upgrade already designed items. Also new to the 4th edition system is updated vehicle operation rules and crafting rules to create your own equipment.

Chapter 5, the final chapter contains all the fluff that helps you fully immerse yourself in a modern or futuristic setting. Everything in this chapter is optional and should only be used to enhance an adventure. Within this chapter you will find rules for living and lifestyle, space travel, mutations, superpowers, and much more.

160269.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 3, Issue 2 - Iconoclast)
160269.description:
From publisher blurb:

Iconoclast

Super Robots gone wrong or just misunderstood. You will have to be the judge of this new HWM character. This issue comes with some great robot droid security guards.

160270.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 3, Issue 3 - New Feats)
160270.description:
From publisher blurb:

New Feats

A great set of new feats for the game. A must have for any HWM fan. This issue also comes with a Landing Pad Battle Tile set.

160271.name: Practical Magic
160271.description:
From publisher blurb:

Practical Magic is a system enhancement for Contagion Second Edition.

The world of Contagion is a dark and terrifying place. On the surface, it looks much like the world you and I live in. Just beneath that surface, in the shadows, rages an ancient conflict between supernatural factions who all seek dominion over the Earth and control over the souls of humanity.

Magic is real in the world of Contagion. Clergy pray to their God for miracles. Magi learn to harness magic in its purest, rawest form. Witches and Shaman use tools passed down through the ages to work their intrinsic art. Magic is a potent force in the world of Contagion. A tool used by the initiated to level the playing field in a world filled with gods and monsters. Like any tool, magic also has practical, everyday uses.

Practical Magic introduces ten new spells and two new feats designed not for fighting the war, but for dealing with daily life. That is not to say that these new spells and feats are without combat application. Far from it. Just as a screwdriver can be used to stab an opponent these “everyday” spells can certainly see use in the battlefield.

Practical Magic includes:

10 new spells for use with Contagion Second Edition
2 new item creation feats: Cure Herbs and Manufacture Pills

160272.name: Army Ants Adventure Journal Issue #2
160272.description:
From publisher blurb:

The adventures of the ants continue! Whether you are rolling up a beetle soldier or planning an expedition into the Termite Mound, you'll find fuel for your Army Ants game within.

160273.description:
Mutate a virus making it more and more lethal. The player that makes their virus 100% lethal first wins. Virus the Card Game is played quickly with simultaneous gameplay.

Player Friendly - It is a card game that is played quickly with simultaneous gameplay. No sitting around for your turn to come up. And it's simple to learn!

Deadly Fun - Even though the subject is serious, it's a fun game with funny flavor text so you can enjoy it with your friends. It's also great for people with an interest in science or biology.

Mutate a Virus - Each player is attempting to mutate their Virus to be the biggest, baddest virus on the table. You will add more and more cards to your Virus by making new Virus Strains. This adds Lethality Points with every card you play.

70 playing cards, 2 rules cards.
160273.name: Virus the Card Game

160274.name: Vihan Lapset - Keskushallinnon opas
160274.description:
Translated for back of the book:
Children of Hate - Central government guide

This guide book is for Central government safety clearance A personnel for eradicating the rebel group known as the Resistance (Vastarinta).

Possession of this book without proper safety clearance will lead to immediate field execution.

160275.name: Vihan Lapset - Vastarintataistelijan opas
160275.description:
Translated for back of the book:
Children of Hate is science fiction horror RPG about alien invaders - THEM - and about Finland after their arrival and global war against THEM, where people are located in strictly regulated cocentration camp-cities and their last hope is The Resistance.

Back of the book in finnish:
Vihan Lapset on tieteiskauhuroolipeli avaruuden valloittajien - NIIDEN - saapumisen ja NIITÄ vastaan soditun maailmanlaajuisen sodan jälkeisestä Suomesta, jossa tiukasti valvottuihin pakkosiirtolakaupunkeihin sijoitettujen ihmisten viimeinen toivo on Vastarinta.

160276.name: Yhteys
160276.description:
Translated for back of the book:
Yhteys (eng. The Connection)
Prologue to Vihan Lapset

John Carpenter's The Thing meets "Heroes of the Nordic Circle".

The characters are employers at a fictional Sokosti weather station in eastern Saariselkä in Lapland. One January night a meteor transporting spores of hostile alien race drops near the station. The spores start to take control of the human mind little by little, in the end making them puppets under control of foreing beings. The Lapland of Yhteys is not Mollberg's, "rillumarei's" or Kummeli's Lapland. It is scary Lapland of wierdly named places and ruggedly beautiful wilderness.

FLOW

Back of the book in finnish:
Yhteys
Esinäytös Vihan Lapsille.

John Carpenterin The Thing kohtaa Napapiirin Sankarit.

Hahmot ovat työntekijöitä kuvitteellisella Sokostin sääasemalla itäisellä Saariselällä Lapissa. Aseman lähelle tipahtaa tammikuisena talvi-iltana vihamielisen avaruusrodun alkioita mukanaan kuljettava meteori. Alkiot ottavat pikku hiljaa ihmisten mielet haltuunsa tehden heistä lopulta nukkeja vieraiden olentojen hallittaviksi. Yhteyden Lappi ei ole Mollbergin, rillumarein ta Kummelin Lappi. Se on outojen paikannimien ja jylhänkauniiden erämaiden pelottava Lappi.

FLOW

160278.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 3, Issue 4 - Deniable Assets)
160278.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deniable Assets

A group of powerful super villains forced to do right? A great organization for any group of heroes to deal with or villains to be forced to join. Comes with some terrorist figure flats.

160279.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 3, Issue 5 - The Roar of the Crowd)
160279.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Roar of the Crowd

Its football season, and this week’s adventure has the heroes dealing with a game that has gone all wrong. Can the heroes win the day and still be able to watch the game?

160280.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 3, Issue 6 - Malius)
160280.description:
From publisher blurb:

Malius

Malius is the personification of the human fear of the “other”. It is the hostile neighboring tribe, the lurking stranger, the terror of unknown humans. For as long as there have been humans these fears have been feeding Malius, and they are what sustain the creature to this day. Malius feeds on the hatred and mistrust between humans and it constantly endeavors to increase the level of this primal fear. This issues also comes with some creepy brain monster figure flats.

160281.name: Rainbow Dragons
160281.description:
From publisher product description:

Presenting the majestic and eccentric Rainbow Dragon an all-new true dragon for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.
Featuring:
Detailed information on the rainbow dragon, their lairs, and unusual habits.
Base statistics and age advancement information.
4 preconstructed rainbow dragons: wyrmling, young, adult, and ancient.
The rainbow dragon alternate sorcerer bloodline.

160282.name: Zündstoff Liebe
160282.description: Each card depicts six questions, one from each of six categories. On a players turn, he/she chooses one question or rolls the category die and answers the question. Depending on the game play variant, the turn passes to the player on the left or the other players judge the given answer.

160283.name: Shall Not Perish
160283.description:
Publisher Blurb:

"Shall Not Perish is a small vignette from the President of the United States regarding Executive Order 13999 issued on July 4th, 2013."



User Summary
This accessory is actually a two page rendition of the executive order, ending with the Twilight 2013 motto: "... and good luck. You're on your own."

160284.name: Sin Mark
160284.description:
User Summary

In Sin Mark you are Akahn, fighting to cleanse evil from your land by finding and destroying the dark gates through which the demons are emerging. An action adventure/RPG game where you progress through the levels by defeating all the demons and destroying their gates. Runes are found along the way which can be crafted into powerful spells enhancing your offensive capabilities. Trinkets drop from some enemies and these again serve to increase your powers. The game is played via keyboard and mouse, A&D for movement, with mouse aiming and clicking to fire arrows and launch spells.

160285.name: Flames of War: Tour of Duty
160285.description:
The Vietnam War (or the American War to the Vietnamese) defined a generation, whether it was through service in Vietnam or opposition to the war. The war in Vietnam, fought nearly half a century ago, remains one of the longest and bloodiest wars since the Second World War. Despite its popular depiction as a guerrilla war of endless patrols and small ambushes, both sides were constantly looking for decisive victories in large-scale battles.

The Free World had all of the advantages of mobility and firepower. Whole battalions flew into battle in helicopters, while the air cavalry rarely even set foot on the ground. Armoured cavalry and mechanised infantry used their M113 ‘tracks’ both for mobility and heavy firepower. Of course, the majority of soldiers were still ‘grunts’ fighting on foot, but even they could call in massive firepower at will.

The Nationalists had the advantages of the home team. They fought as guerrillas, appearing as if from nowhere to ambush the Free World forces hunting them and used local knowledge to outwit their foes. Later, as the war progressed, they switched to conventional tactics using armoured forces in open battle.

This book allows you to recreate these battles on the tabletop using the popular Flames Of War rules.

160286.name: The Metabarons Quick Start-Up Rules
160286.description:
From the publisher blurb:

Prepare yourself to enter the exciting universe of Metabarons: The Roleplaying Game. This hand-out will help you learn to play the game in only a few minutes. Read it, then ask the gamemaster any questions you might have about roleplaying or how this game works.

160287.name: Dead Simple Fantasy RPG Rules
160287.description:
From the author's site:

Like an growing number of roleplayers over the last two decades I have found the increasing complexity and length of most commercial roleplaying systems overwhelming. I’m sorry everyone, but I like to play RPG’s for fun, not as a second life. I like to be carried along by the story, not the dice. I like to spend my playing time finding creative solutions to seemingly intractable problems, not rolling handfuls of dice against skill tables to see if I succeed. (...)

Already known for my ability to distill a wargame down to a single page (FUBAR) I decided to try and do the same with a classic fantasy RPG. Well folks I failed.. well not entirely. Dead Simple is indeed a single page, but I couldn’t help myself and wrote a dozen supplements on such things as creating dungeons, villages, cities and monsters, each a single page long.

So the rules now span a dozen pages, but you still only need the first page to play a game. You can create and develop a character and play it in a game with that single page.

160288.name: Total Conquest
160288.description:
User Summary

Total Conquest is a strategic social game where you are a Roman governor developing your own city-state and army. But with Caesar dead You’ll need to join a legion or forge your own to defeat your enemies, protect your lands, and reign supreme.

160289.name: Supplement 1: Dead Simple Game Mastering
160289.description:
From the author's site:

Like an growing number of roleplayers over the last two decades I have found the increasing complexity and length of most commercial roleplaying systems overwhelming. I’m sorry everyone, but I like to play RPG’s for fun, not as a second life. I like to be carried along by the story, not the dice. I like to spend my playing time finding creative solutions to seemingly intractable problems, not rolling handfuls of dice against skill tables to see if I succeed. (...)

Already known for my ability to distill a wargame down to a single page (FUBAR) I decided to try and do the same with a classic fantasy RPG. Well folks I failed.. well not entirely. Dead Simple is indeed a single page, but I couldn’t help myself and wrote a dozen supplements on such things as creating dungeons, villages, cities and monsters, each a single page long.

So the rules now span a dozen pages, but you still only need the first page to play a game. You can create and develop a character and play it in a game with that single page.

160290.name: Dead Simple Supplement 2:  Going Underground
160290.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Here are some simple steps to help a new GM build
his first dungeon.

160291.name: Dead Simple Supplement 3:  Loot!
160291.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Most monsters have loot on them which the Adventurers can take if they kill or capture them.
Chests also contain loot, but may be locked and trapped.

As GM you can choose what loot to give out or you can use the random tables below. It is entirely up to you how you want to play it.

160292.name: Dead Simple Supplement 4: The Marketplace
160292.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

There will come a time when the Adventurers want more than the Village of Grobblet can provide & will travel to the nearest town or city.
Here they will be able to buy anything they could get in Grobblet & much, much more.
This supplement widens their horizons & offers the DM a number of roleplaying opportunities as the Adventurers come up against their most devious opponents to date – the Merchants.

160293.name: Dead Simple Supplement 5: The Village of Grobblet
160293.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Although we positively encourage players to devise their own setting, this is an example so you can play
straight away.

160294.name: Dead Simple Supplement 6A: Denizens of the Dark
160294.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Below are the descriptions for the most numerous denizens of the dark realms of the Under-earth.

160295.name: Dead Simple Supplement 6B: Dark Forests...
160295.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

The many forests of the Known World are not quiet welcoming places. They are dark, mysterious and full of dangerous foes for the Adventurers to face.

160296.name: Dead Simple Supplement 6C: Death is only the beginning...
160296.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

No fantasy world would be complete without the Living Dead. From the simple, shambling Zombie to the terrible Majesty of a Vampire or Mummy High Priest, each brings horripliations of terror to any dungeon or crypt.

160297.name: Dead Simple Supplement 7: The Big City!
160297.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Few things scare a new GM more than the thought of creating a City. In a dungeon there's just a few monsters and rooms to worry about, but a city could have thousands.
In fact creating a city is actually pretty easy. It's all a matter of thinking like a film director. All he needs to make you think your hero is in a city are Sets (usually 2 dimensional building fronts), some props and some extras - and ... action!

160298.name: Dead Simple Supplement 9: Oh My God!
160298.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

One of the most fun things about running a roleplaying game are the Gods. They define everything, they can be glorious, they can be mysterious. They can act directly, or through agents and avatars. They can even act through those miserable little beings called heroes.

160299.name: Dead Simple Supplement 10: Out of the Dungeon
160299.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

These monsters were sent to recce the human town, but when they returned the Dungeon had been trashed and all their betters were dead.
A golden opportunity for them to create a new underground empire. All they have to do is subdue the survivors and keep those pesky adventurers at bay...

160300.name: Paper Sorcerer
160300.description:
User Summary

Paper Sorcerer is a fantasy computer RPG that mixes first-person exploration and turn-based combat. A sorcerer trapped inside a magical book by a band of heroes, you must escape your paper prison by summoning minions to your party, defeating the many guardians and uncovering the secrets of the book.

160301.name: Busiris Fantasy RPG Rules
160301.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Busiris is a colony of a distant, almost fabled, Empire. It is a melting pot where the high culture & ancient magic of the Empire meets a new continent full of promise & danger. Here the Old Deities compete with the Wild Spirit Lords of the interior & their feral magic.

Being a place of both peril & fabulous riches it attracts the best & worst men of the Empire. Ambitious Princes, devious Priests & greedy Merchants rub shoulders with Mercenaries, Adventurers & Tomb Robbers.

Everyone is out to make their fortune & advance their destiny far from the stultifying & oppressive ‘harmony’ of the Empire proper. Intrigue, conspiracy & betrayal are as common as the rain is not.

160302.name: Busiris RPG: Game Master’s Companion
160302.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Becoming a Games Master (GM) in Busiris can be great fun, especially when everyone is enjoying themselves. The real key to doing this is to be relaxed about the game and its rules. Never let a rule get in the way of the story or people having fun.

160303.name: Busiris RPG: Citizens of Busiris
160303.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

The City and Province of has a wealth of people who will become the Adventurers’ allies or their enemies, and sometimes both. This supplement gives the GM a range of people to use in their adventures. It will also be referred to from the various published adventures to save both time and space.

160304.name: Busiris RPG: City Bestiary
160304.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

There are creatures and races that exist in, under and around the City of Busiris, that regard the arrival of the Empire with sinister intent.
Some are mindless, yet dangerous, beasts. Others have a malign intelligence to match that of the incomers into what they regard as their territory.

160305.name: Busiris RPG: The Souk
160305.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

The main form of currency in Busiris is the silver coin. These are minted by an Imperial Monopoly and bear the glyph of the current Emperor on one side. All coins are square and have a hole in the middle so that they can be threaded together. Silver coins are minted in One, Six and Twelve silver denominations.

160306.name: Busiris RPG: The Temples
160306.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

More than in many roleplaying games, Busiris is dominated by its Deities. The people of the Empire worship six main Deities and a host of minor spirits and their ancestors. This worship is direct and heartfelt, there are no atheists in the Empire as the evidence of these deities’ existence is seen every day.

Nothing happens in the Empire without the acquiescence of the Temples, and even the Emperor - a living Deity himself, has to take into account their needs and wishes. A wise Emperor will set each Temple off against its rivals, a foolish one will be dominated by one or more of them.

160307.name: Busiris RPG: Beyond the City Walls
160307.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Although the City of Busiris itself is a fascinating place to explore and adventure in, it is just a gateway to an entire world. Beyond its ancient cyclopean walls lie towns and lush farmland, soaring mountains, the immense expanse of the Great Salt Desert, and beyond this the dangers and fabulous wealth of the jungle interior.

Each of these locations has a history, and part to play in modern Busiris. Underlying all of them, however, are the ruins and terrible secrets of the Ancient Ones.

160308.name: Busiris RPG  Adventure 1: The Lion Roars
160308.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

The Emperor has chosen to remove the Governorship of Busiris, and the Kif Monopoly, from the El-Jebir, and give it to the El-Karan. This change is supposed to go smoothly, however, these things seldom do. The El-Karan are planning for the worst and are recruiting mercenaries to assist in their ‘peaceful’ takeover.

160309.name: INOQONI
160309.description:
INOQONI needs help !

During walk with her mother, INOQONI discovered a mysterious tower in the middle of the forest. Curious, she ventured inside and was captured. She must face disturbing creatures inhabiting the rooms while avoiding the pitfalls in her way.

To help INOQONI to escape from this tower, you will cross 60 rooms filled with puzzles and all kinds of dangers. Learn to use the magic mirror, capture the butterflies and finish each level as quickly as possible to score more points!

Quickly discover this magical and mysterious universe where skill and quick-thinking are key!

Source: The Developer Website.

160310.name: Nasty, Brutal & Short
160310.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Deep beneath the world of man all the ancient races still abide. The most numerous are the Goblins who make their living by stealing from the world of man and doing the bidding of more powerful beings.

Life for a Goblin is nasty, brutal and short, so they form gangs for mutual protection. These are rules for playing these Goblins in the modern world. Goblins form gangs for mutual protection and amusement while adventuring. Goblins run by players should all be part of the same gang.

160311.name: Going Down!: The World of Nasty, Brutal and Short
160311.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

"Life is nasty, brutal and short & so are you." With that phrase in mind this game gives you the opportunity to play a vicious, malicious, selfish, pompous, aggressive yet cowardly little git to your heart’s content.
No noble quests for fair maidens, no heroic treks across the wilderness for just the fame, and no great battles against hordes of evil foes for just the glory!

Goblins are unique. More than that, they are amazing! They can survive (and are frequently forced to) where no other creature can. They live in underground swamps, tombs, semi-submerged caverns, lava tubes (even active ones), under the floors of houses, in sewers and cesspits.

160312.name: The Maltese Goblin
160312.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Back in Renaissance Italy a rather stupid Goblin posed for Leonardo Da Vinci. The astute Italian created a statuette of the goblin and cast it in Bronze. At this point the Inquisition (a forerunner of The Agency) stepped in and confiscated it.

Fast forward six hundred years and the statuette, the notorious Maltese Goblin, has gone through a dozen owners bringing terrible fortune to each and has it just been acquired by the Metropolitan Museum of Social History and Art in New York. It is to be put on display tomorrow for the first time in its long and troubled history.

160313.name: SG 1895 Adventure 1: The Feathered Serpent
160313.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

The Explorers begin their adventures at a critical moment in Goa'uld History, the Great Civil War.

After centuries of relative peace between the Goa’uld System Lords, the To'kra (rebel Goa’uld) have managed to sow distrust and discord between the members of the Goa'uld council. Ra and Anubis, in particular, have begun a series of escalating engagements about the possession of a number of Naqada-rich mining worlds (Anubis is not yet ascended).

160314.name: Stargate 1895: Victorian SciFi Roleplaying Game
160314.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

In November of 1893 the renowned Egyptologist Lord Conway made an amazing discovery in the Qattara Depression. It was in a previously unsurveyed temple complex, buried beneath the floor of what appeared to be a great tomb. (...)

The newly formed Office of Exploratory Studies has recruited the players as an exploratory team.

160315.name: Stargate 1895: The Story So far...
160315.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

The exploratory team have been fully briefed by Holmes’ second-in-command, John McKay, on the train journey to the Conway estate in Yorkshire. Nothing though prepares them for the actual sight as they alight from the carriages that brought them up from the small station.

160316.name: Tales of Prax
160316.description: This RPG uses both the Dead Simple rule system and the Glorantha setting.

160317.name: Tales of Prax Supplement 1: The Cults of Prax
160317.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

The divine cults are at the very core of life in Glorantha & thus this RPG. Much of the unique flavour of Greg Stafford's creation flows from these organizations.

The Cult rules in Tales of Prax are the basic ones for lay membership of some of the common cults. They allow you to quickly create a Hero & get playing. The rules in this supplement expand on this & create paths for the Heroes to follow as they develop.

In this supplement there are full descriptions of these paths for a few of the most common cults. Others are described in the same format in other supplements.

160318.name: Tales of Prax Supplement 2: The Tent of Issaries
160318.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

There will come a time when the Adventurers need equipment and will travel to the nearest town or market.
This supplement widens their horizons & offers the GM a number of roleplaying opportunities as the Adventurers come up against their most devious opponents to date – the Traders.

160319.name: Baśka Kaszubska
160319.description:
The traditional Card Game played with the 16 card deck by 4 players. The game is very popular in some Polish regions especially in Kaszuby in Pomerania.

The game is called sometimes the Kaszubian Bridge. Game is played in the sequence (e.g. 16) of rounds. Each round starts from the bidding than, depends on the type of agreed contract, sequence of tricks is played. Round can be played in schema 2 vs 2 or 1 vs 3 depend on the agreed contract. Similarly different card hierarchies are possible.
Interesting twist is that the personalities of players in 2 vs 2 teams are revealed during the play (the owners of 2 black Queens and in some cases one of Jacks plays together).

160320.description:
Objective: Be the first reaching target space
- moving by turns -
Story: A lonesome dog (Red Rover), who lives in the forest tries to catch children being on a race through the woods because he's seeking company.

Each player moves forward according die roll; simultaneously red rover is moved, too, starting from his 'lonesome lodge'. There are some spaces players are safe or must follow instructions; as soon as Red Rover ends on the same space a payer stands or has moved to he/she's caught for one round. Next turn player is going to escape joining the party again on the very last position.

Adventure in the lands of the northern lights.

The Super Patriot

The Circus of Crime

160325.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 3, Issue 10 - The Frank Murray Nanocloud)

The Frank Murray Nano Cloud

When an average guy becomes a god, things can go wrong real fast? This issue also comes with some great robot figure flats.

Bank Crisis

A bank robbery, it might seem a common sight in the super hero genera, but that’s because they are a great way to show off your super powers and save the day.

Comes with a battle Mat of the bank, and figure flats of all sorts of people inside.

160340.name: Daniel Tiger's Neighborhood Grr-ific Game
160340.description: Players choose 1 of 5 characters from the popular PBS tv show, "Daniel Tiger's Neighborhood" to collect their friends in a trolley for a party at the clock factory. Along the way, players get to use their imagination to act out scenes or emotions from the tv show.

160341.name: Squinkies Boys Battle Game
160341.description:
This is a game with custom rubber dice made for small rubber figures called Squinkies. Each player starts the game with a number of Squinkies.

The game is played on a six square grid with symbols in each of the grids and a 'Pit' where spare fighters are kept (a downloadable PDF).

Players take turns rolling a die. The die roll determines whether you remove Squinkies from play, regenerate previously defeated Squinkies, lose a turn or reroll a die.

The last player that has Squinkies remaining wins the game.

160343.name: SOE21 Modern  Espionage RPG
160343.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

During the second world war an elite secret force was formed to attack the enemy from within. Its methods were subversion, sabotage, assassination and terror. Many of its agents did not survive. Often captured, tortured and executed, their work was cloaked in secrecy and all but forgotten. They were the Special Operations Executive (SOE).

At the end of the war they were sacrificed upon the altar of political necessity and disbanded. The victims of inter-agency rivalry. Or were they?

In the world of SOE21, not so very different from our own, Churchill secretly ordered that the SOE was to continue, as the hidden and deniable agent of Britain’s otherwise less acceptable activities.

160344.name: To Go Boldly: Simple Star Trek RPG
160344.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

This is a simple roleplaying game based in the universe created by the original series of Star Trek. Where people had trouble with Tribbles, overacting was considered the baseline, and Klingons were rascally villains with smooth foreheads. I have mostly ignored the films and modern series altogether.

The players create characters that are fresh out of Starfleet Academy. Their first posting is as a Ensigns on a survey team and they are assigned to an Explorer Class vessel called the USS Magellan.

This has a crew of eighty, including a veteran Captain and Executive Officer. The rest of the crew are like the players, greenhorns. This is how Starfleet in this era weeds out those who just will not make it in the field. Those that don't make the grade will be transferred back to Earth to work in desk jobs, others will come home in small steel capsules.

160345.name: The USS Magellan
160345.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

This is a simple roleplaying game based in the universe created by the original series of Star Trek. Where people had trouble with Tribbles, overacting was considered the baseline, and Klingons were rascally villains with smooth foreheads. I have mostly ignored the films and modern series altogether.

160346.name: Inscrutable: One page Oriental Fantasy Roleplaying Rules
160346.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

This variant of the Dead Simple RPG Rules places the players in medieval Nihon. A land of honour, mystery and intrigue.

160347.name: Legendary Creatures of Nihon
160347.description:
user summary

This PDF contains several Eastern creatures of myth to be used with the Inscrutable RPG.

160348.description:
18SA is an 18xx game which is set in South America.

The players are seeking to make the most money by buying and selling stock certificates of eleven railroad companies. The player with the most stock of a particular company in his possession acts as the president of this company and is responsible for track laying, the placement of railheads (which are necessary for train runs), route selection and train acquisition. Running trains earns money and this money is either divided by the shareholders or kept in the company's treasure for further investments (like buying better trains or constructing track). This decision influences the value of the company's shares - and not the player with the most stock or the most beautiful constructed track wins the game, but the player with the most riches in terms of cash and shares.

The game differs from the usual 18xx games a little, as it uses different tokens for either passenger trains or freight trains. The companies also face a lot of building costs - mountains, Amazonas swamps, and crossing a border into another country costs extra.
160348.name: 18SA

160349.name: Robotrino
160349.description:
You're a mad scientist bent on world domination. Experiments of battle to determine the strongest Destroying robot is repeated endlessly.Pilots of the most skillful robot approaches to conquer the world.

Robotorino is trick taking game to play by a special effect cards of four and numbers cards of four. It is important to guess that you are thinking of each other.

By it is order to know who is dealt a card, it deal cards face up.

Each player is set to face down robot card and effects card.

The trick battle in the order in which it was decided in advance.

160350.name: Mutant: Genlab Alfa
160350.description:
User Blurb:

After the big catastrophe men fled to enclaves deep in the earth. In genetic laboratories she tried to create a new being, a genetic mix of human and animal. Intelligent, but also hardy enough to live in the post apocalyptic wasteland. The devastation caught up with the humans and the enclaves fell, one after another, but the mutated animals fight for freedom has just started.

Mutant: Genlab Alfa (Mutant Genetic Lab Alpha) is the first large expansion for the RPG Mutant: År Noll (Mutant: Year Zero). It allows you to play perhaps the most iconic of all of Mutant's creatures, the mutated animal. Mutant: Genlab Alfa can even be played as a standalone game.

Book #1: Djuret (The Animal) describes how you create your character, skills, talents, and animal abilities, fighting, and an overview of Paradisdalen (Paradise Valley) - the home and jail of the mutated animals.

Book #2: Paradiset (Paradise) contains the wide spanning campaign Flykten från Paradiset (Escape from Paradise) with pictures, maps, and handouts. The book also contains lots of new illustrated monsters, phenomena, and artifacts.

The box set also contains 50 playing cards with animal abilities, and artifacts, 100 food, water, and arrow counters, 15 custom dice, and a double-sided color map of Paradisdalen and its eight animal clans' home territories.

160351.name: World of Tanks: Rush – M2 Light Tank
160351.description: World of Tanks: Rush — M2 Light Tank, a promotional card for the World of Tanks: Rush base game available at conventions and through hobby stores, features a light Amercian tank that costs 1, gives 1 resource, and has a Sabotage ability.

boardgamecompilation: World of Tanks: Rush – Deluxe Edition
160352.description: Second Front — the first expansion for World of Tanks: Rush, a deck-building strategy card game in which your mission is to assemble a powerful tank squadron — adds the nation of Great Britain, twelve achievements, a fourth special base for every player, a new play zone, and two new card abilities. Some minor changes for the basic mechanisms of the game are proposed. The game with the expansion can be played with up to six players instead of the five-player limit of the base game.
160352.name: World of Tanks: Rush 2 - Second Front

160353.description:
LUGU is a storytelling card game where players compete for the highest score while creating a story together.

Each player has an identical deck of 22 cards, each featuring a different, abstract picture. The storyteller in each round will select 4 cards at random from their deck and use the pictures on these cards as inspiration to create a story.

The other players will attempt to match the storyteller's card with a card from their deck. Players score points if they correctly match. The storyteller scores points if a player matches but not if all of the players match. Each player will build onto the story created by the first storyteller, resulting in a large story that all players contribute to. After everyone has been the storyteller twice the story is over and the highest score wins.
160353.name: LUGU

160354.name: Campaign Chunks Volume Two
160354.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Campaign Chunk is an item, place or something else that can fit into any campaign or story with little or no modification, although some will be more suited to certain genres than others.

They have few stats and can help provide starting grounds for adventures or help fill in the gaps when your players go off exploring and you need something for them to do. Each has several hooks or rumour that can be used. Which of these are true and which are false?

Originally first published on the blog/website of Ennead Games, these Chunks have been compiled into a handy volume. Their details may have been cleaned up and more hooks or rumours added to them, but they basically the same.

This edition of Campaign Chunks features:

Anima/Soul spice - A spice with some unuseal properties is very popular
Blue Cloud - A rare phenomena
Central Hall - Simply put, its THE place for theatre and music-hall visitors
Great Deep Abyss - Not the deepest part of the ocean, but something weird is going on here
Organ Harvesting - A nasty and deadly practice, the question is why?
Southern Dig Site - The ruins of a military outpost, thought lost to time
S.S Brünnhilde - A military testing ship with some experimental technology
Sturges Canal - The lifeblood of a region, very popular. Too popular for some people
Touchhelm Carnival - A time to celebrate the founding of the city
Ultra Olympics - Take the olympics, allow "cheating" and sit back and enjoy the fun

160355.name: Thirteen Pines: A Tale of Supernatural Horror
160355.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deep in San Juan Mountain range the characters are trapped in the town of Thirteen Pines. A raging blizzard has cut them off from the outside world and something ancient and evil is hunting them. This atmospheric 36 page horror tale is easily adapted to your favorite game system. Can your players survive?

160356.name: The Pirates of Leng
160356.description:
From the Intro:

Ia! Ia! A Pirate’s Life for Me! Ia! Ia! A Pirate’s Life for Me!

The Pirates of Leng is a role-playing game set in an alternate world where, instead of the Americas, an Elder world of creatures based off of H.P. Lovecraft’s works exists.
Players will be taking the part of a pirate crew, sharing in action, adventure, bounty and backstabbing as they try to strike it rich on the high seas.

160357.name: Nevermore: A Horror Fantasy Adventure
160357.description:
From publisher blurb:

It is a night darker than any can recall. A great storm rages from the North forcing the characters to take refuge at Raven Rock Keep. Before the night is ended the characters will learn that an evil has emerged into the world. The Demon that is Dreaming has awoken and for the sake of the realm the characters must undetake a desperate quest with only the light of Gilead to guide them.

This 43 page fantasy horror adventure takes place in the a dark ages setting and is inspired by The Raven written by Edgar Allen Poe. It can be used with any game system although D20 stats are provided. This one off adventure is set in a dark low fantasy world and is for good characters.

160358.name: Hard Times at the Greybar Hotel
160358.description:
From publisher blurb:

The characters have recently been transferred to the Norfolk Correctional Facility. They quickly learn that to survive they are going to have to figure out how to avoid offending the various factions that behind the prison walls; The Brotherhood, The Mavens and a godfather like exmobster all vie for power. As if not getting shived is tough enough now the prison guards are acting weird. There are no visitations or TV service and rec time in the yard has been cancelled until further notice. Something is wrong but the warden is keeping you and your fellow inmates in rthe dark about the TRIBULATION OF THE DEAD.

160359.name: Jail Break
160359.description:
From publisher blurb:

The dead are coming back to life and the characters are trapped inside Norfolk Correctional Facility. The characters find themselves in the middle of a prison riot with a crazy warden and his guards on one side and the various prison gangs on the other. They need an escape plan and they need one fast. This is volume 2 of a 12 volumes series set in the world overrun by zombies. The chance to play prisoners should provide your group with an interesting role playing opportunity.

160360.name: World Gone Wrong
160360.description:
From publisher blurb:

The characters have escaped Norfolk Prison but now find themselves in a desperate struggle for survival against both the dead and the living on the outside. Part 3 of this series provides you with a wide variety of random and scripted enounters to throw at the group as they make their way East towards a rumoured safe haven.

160361.name: From Eden to Anarchy
160361.description:
From publisher blurb:

The characters have safely arrived at Stetsen Airport which is controlled by remnants of the US Military and the Department of Disease Control (DDC). The group is soon forced to choose between the safety of the survivor camp and travelling to the nearby town of Middleborough to rescue a loved one from the Survivors of Anarchy. This chapter provides more encounter tables, NPC encounters, moral choices, and location descriptions (with MAPS!).

160362.name: The Terrible Truth
160362.description:
From publisher blurb:

The characters have returned to Stetson Airport only to learn that a large army of the dead is about to descend on the refuge. Amidst the chaos the characters must decide whether to stay and find their friends or accept an offer to escape with the military to the Plum Island facility.

This chapter is broken into two sections depending on which path the characters take. As with previous installments, this chapter includes more encounter tables, npc events, moral choices and provides the characters with some additional insight into the Terrible Truth behind the rising dead.

160363.name: The Coming Terror
160363.description:
From publisher blurb:

After their harrowing escape from the refugee camp at Stetson Airport only the town of Kingston stands between the characters and reaching the coast. No easy task for the town has become a gathering place for the dead and they are evolving. Discover the sinister secret behind the rise of the dead in this dramatic conclusion.

160364.name: 55 Below 0 and 6 Feet From Hell: Part I
160364.description:
From publisher blurb:

The continent of Antarctica holds many mysteries. As members of Ross Station it will be up to the characters to unravel a mystery with origins 65 years earlier in war torn Europe. This is part one of a two part series that offers intense action, great role playing opportunities and leads into a lovecraftian style horror. In addition to part I of this exciting adventure this document contains a map and room by room description of Ross Station, fantastic art and detailed NPC descriptions (each with their own portrait).

160365.name: 55 Below 0 and 6 Feet From Hell: Part II
160365.description:
From publisher blurb:

The continent of Antarctica holds many mysteries. As the survivors of Ross Station come to terms with the loss of their friends and colleagues an even great evil awaits them at the Russian facility of Smolensk. It will be up to the characters to unravel a mystery with origins 65 years earlier in war torn Europe. This is PART TWO of a two part series that offers intense action, great role playing opportunities and a strong dose of lovecraftian style horror. This exciting adventure offers maps, fantastic art and detailed NPC descriptions (each with their own portrait).

160366.name: Flextiles
160366.description:
from the package

Flextiles are the amazing 25mm scale sheets of colorful plastic scenery that will add a new dimension in your role-playing game! The durable electrostatic plastic is flexible, reusable, and can easily be drawn on with water-soluble inks. PLUS you can see through the translucent ink to the edges to your map underneath, AND these Flextiles won't fly off the table when someone sneezes! Flextiles lay very flat on your paper, vinyl, or acetate maps. THey don't move when you want them to stay put; but when you want to shift their position, Flextiles easily lift on and off any map surface.

Flextiles are designed for use with the CHAMPIONS game map, but can be used with any role-playing game. Look for more sets in the Flextiles series!

The Perfect Organism

160368.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 4, Issue 3 - New Powers)
160368.description:

New Powers

New Powers to make your heroes even more super.

160369.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 4, Issue 4 - The Shadow Clinic)
160369.description:

The Shadow Clinic
